news.title: Google invests in Fervo’s $462M round to unlock even more geothermal energy
news.summary: Fervo Energy's Series E round will help the company build additional phases of its Cape Station power plant while beginning development on new sites.

news.title: Meesho’s $606M IPO pops as enthusiasm for India’s e-commerce startups rises
news.summary: Meesho had a good first day as a public company, with its shares climbing as much as 46% from its issue price as investors jumped to grab a piece of the company built around small merchants and value-conscious consumers.

news.title: Fertility startup Inito wants to use AI-designed antibodies to expand at-home health tests
news.summary: Inito has raised $29 million in new funding to invest in and develop AI-engineered antibodies that will help it offer new types of tests and improve the accuracy of existing ones.

news.title: CoreWeave CEO defends AI circular deals as ‘working together’
news.summary: The CEO of the AI data center provider, which has Nvidia as an investor and a supplier, described the environment as a "violent change" in demand.

news.title: Unconventional AI confirms its massive  $475M seed round
news.summary: Led by Naveen Rao, the former head of AI at Databricks, the new hardware startup is valued at $4.5 billion.

news.title: Call of Duty won’t release Modern Warfare or Black Ops back-to-back anymore
news.summary: Future Call of Duty releases will no longer include back-to-back launches of Modern Warfare or Black Ops games, Activision announced on Tuesday. news.summary: Conservative justices seem ready to back Trump control of independent agencies.

news.title: ‘It Was Nuts’: The Extreme Tests that Show Why Hail Is a Multibillion-Dollar Problem
news.summary: The costs of a hail damage have ballooned over the past two decades, prompting researchers to resort to extreme measures to understand how these storms destroy buildings.

news.title: Scientists Thought Parkinson’s Was in Our Genes. It Might Be in the Water
news.summary: Parkinson’s disease has environmental toxic factors, not just genetic.

news.title: Kids and Teen Influencers in Australia Say ‘Bye-Bye’ to Social Media
news.summary: Starting Wednesday, Australia will prohibit kids under 16 from using social platforms. For youth content creators, it means logging off or finding creative ways to post anyway.
